_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

Missouri Prime Beef Packers in Pleasant Hope, MO operates a beef processing plant with cold storage.



Ammonia is used at our facility as the cooling medium in our refrigeration system. The ammonia is contained in a closed loop system; it is designed to remain inside the piping and vessels in our facility.  We believe that ammonia provides the safest and most efficient cooling choice for our operation. 



A. Accident Release Prevention and Emergency Policies 

It is the Policy of Missouri Prime Beef Packers, to conduct business in a manner that is safe to the employees, the community, and the environment. The Company's officers, managers and supervisors are accountable to carry out the policies of Missouri Prime Beef Packers relevant to the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous materials.



Missouri Prime Beef Packers has made a determined effort to develop a plan to prevent releases of extremely hazardous substances. In the development of this plan, Missouri Prime Beef Packers has used numerous resources both inside and outside the Pleasant Hope facility. EPA's Risk Management Program and OSHA's Process Safety Management Program provided the guidelines in the development of the Prevention Plan.



In the event of an accidental release Missouri Prime Beef Packers has developed and implemented an Emergency Action Plan. The Emergency Action Plan provides guidance for identifying and reporting accidental releases. The Emergency Action Plan includes an incident command system for decision-making authority for each stage of an accidental release. The facility has coordinated with public responders and local emergency services to enhance public safety. 



B. Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled 

Ammonia is the only substance covered by the Accidental Release Prevention Regulations handled at this facility. 



C. Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program 

The facility has an accident release prevention program

that complies with Occupational Safety and Health Act's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk Management Program Rule. The prevention program consists of the following elements: 

Employee Participation Program

Process Safety Information

Process Hazard Analysis

Operating Procedures

Training Program

Contractor Safety Program

Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures

Mechanical Integrity Program

Hot Work Permit Procedures

Management of Change Procedures

Incident Investigation Procedures

Compliance Audit Procedures 



D. Five-Year Accident History 

No ammonia-related accidents have occurred at the facility over the past five years that resulted in significant onsite or offsite consequences.

 

 

E. Description of the Emergency Response Program 

It is the Policy of Missouri Prime Beef Packers to conduct business in a manner that is safe to the employees, the community, and the environment. The Company's officers, managers and supervisors are accountable to carry out the policies of Missouri Prime Beef Packers relevant to the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous materials.



Missouri Prime Beef Packers has made a determined effort to develop a plan to prevent Missouri Prime Beef Packers has used numerous resources both inside and outside the Pleasant Hope facility. EPA's Risk Management Program and OSHA's Process Safety Management Program provided the guidelines in the development of the Prevention Plan.



In the event of an accidental release, Missouri Prime Beef Packers has developed and implemented an Emergency Action Plan. The Emergency Action Plan provides guidance for identifying and reporting accidental releases. The Emergency Action Plan includes an incident command system for decision-making authority for each stage of an accidental release. The facility has coordinated with public responders and local emergency services to enhance public safety.



F. Planned Changes to Improve Safety 

Future changes to improve release preve
ntion include addition of new technology as it becomes available, and continued training of plant personnel.
